question.questionText: Look at the schematic diagram including a D-cell battery and 3 bulbs. Why do the other 2 bulbs stay lit if the middle bulb burns out?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The circuit is parallel, so each bulb has its own pathway to the D-cell battery, so the bulbs that do not burn out continue to shine.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: It is a parallel that is why just that one will go out.
It is a parallel circuit and each light bulb has its own path to the D-Cell or power supply.
It will happen because it is a parallel circuit.
I chose this answer because it is a series.
